Posts.Content: connette wrote: I am wondering if anyone was sent back to their BS after their first mammogram.  I had a lumpectomy with clear margins/no node involvement on March 13.  Yesterday, I went for my first mammogram---needed to start radiation.  I've had 4 cycles of AC.  The tests show an area of concern on my breast by the scar from my lump.  The radiologist then did an ultrasound and was still concerned.  He called my BS and discussed his thoughts.  She in return called me and wants to see me Monday with my films.  She did tell me that I should calm down because it likely is not cancer but something from the surgery.  Scar tissue, blood pool, etc.   Has any of my sisters been in this situation?  Please share. . .Thank you and God bless Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: concerns with 1st mamo. after lump. connette connette

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 07:04PM connette wrote: Thank you for taking the time to reply.  It is always comforting to have someone share ideas.  I do not post very often because I'm not "computer smart".  However, I do read many of the comments and have learned many facts that have prepared me for my journey.  Connette
Posts.Title: concerns with 1st mamo. after lump. connette connette

Posts.Content: May 2, 2009 11:56AM connette wrote: Shannon56, I am ER-/PR+ and HER2+,and started chemo on April 15.  I have tried to post 3 times today, but our computer is acting strange and won't submit my message.  Just wanted you to know that you are not alone.  I'll try and find you when our computer is fixed.  Connette
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo April 2009 tulipbebe MissouriCatLady

Posts.Content: May 4, 2009 06:02PM connette wrote:  I started chemo in April, also.  But have had problems with the computer.  I'm not that great at computer skills so it didn't take much to frustrate me.  My DX is the same as Shannon56.  ER-/PR+ and HER2+.  I had a lumpectomy on March 13.  My treatment plan (at this time) is 4 cycles of AC (I started on April 15), radiation, 4 cycles of taxol/carboplatin and herceptin the rest of my year.  I have just started losing my hair and I'm not sure when should shave my head.  I have good days and bad days (like everyone else).  These discussions are wonderful.  They help build confidence, courage and strength.  Thank you, everyone.  I am a Kindergarten/1st grade teacher and I always say there is no such thing as a dumb question, , , so here it goes.  Does DH stand for dear husband?  Connette
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo April 2009 tulipbebe MissouriCatLady

Posts.Content: May 5, 2009 09:52AM connette wrote: Hello, everyone.  I received a call from my onc's office this morning saying that my white count is down and needed to have a low dose shot of Neulastin (or something that begins with an N).  Does this happen to most women?  I have had 2 IV's of AC and will have my third IV (hopefully), tomorrow.  I need another blood test before they will continue my treatment.  You know, I read so many of discussions and think I understand what everyone is talking about and then when a side effect happens to me, I go blank and can't remember anything.  Everybody always seems so brave to me and I can't tell you all how much I admire your courage and knowledge.  Connette
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo April 2009 tulipbebe MissouriCatLady
